00021         virtual void Clear(Option_t *opt = "C");
00022 
00023         //Getters
00024         Int_t GetRunNumber(void) {return fRunNumber;}

00034         Int_t GetBlindnessWord(void) {return fBlindnessWord;}

00036         Bool_t IsBlind(void) {return false;}
00037

00051         void SetBlindnessWord(Int_t aNum) {fBlindnessWord = aNum;}
00052         void SetGSEventNumber(UInt_t aNum) {fGSEventNumber = aNum;}
00053         void SetDataCleaning(Int_t aWord) {fDataCleaningBits = aWord;}
00054 private:
00055         Int_t fRunNumber; //big Run number. the small run number is found in the Bolometer data record
00056         Double_t fRunStartTime;
00057         Double_t fRunEndTime;
00058         
00059         Double_t fEdwGlobalEventTime;
00060         Int_t fGigaStamp;
00061         Int_t fStamp;
00062         
00063         Double_t fTimeSinceLastEvent;
00064         Int_t fTriggerType; //0x1 for Bolo event, 0x2 for Muon System, 0x4 if NC counter, 0x8 for next system, etc... 
00065         Int_t fDataType; //0x1 for raw Edw data, 0x2 for HLA Event, 0x4 for MC "raw", 0x8 for MC HLA type ?? is this a good or bad thing? what if somebody sets it to 0x5!
00066 
00067         Int_t fDetectorStatusWord;
00068         Int_t fBlindnessWord;
00069         UInt_t fGSEventNumber; //Global Software Event Number. starts from 1 with each new Run
00070         
00071         Int_t fDataCleaningBits;  //each bit in this word represents the pass/fail of this event to specific data cleaning cuts
00072         
00073   ClassDef(EdwTestEventClass,1);
